page.title: 09CHURCH FARM,MONKTON FARLEIGH
page.content: On Friday 7th June a group of us went to interview Mr. and Mrs. Tucker at { Church Farm, Monkton Farleigh.}It is called Church Farm because its next to the{Church.}The main farm building is about 400 years old. It was built in 1593. The farm has belonged to the Tuckers since 1927.Before that their relatives the Cottles owned it. The {land use}is mostly {arable}(wheat and barley). They have 53 acres, 7 fields, and a lot of{animals}like : cows, pigs, sheep, horses, a goat- and turkeys...before Christmas!!!. They have a lot of{farm machinery}on the farm such as tractors, a plough, corndrill, harrows, a hedge cutter and a roller. Mr.and Mrs.Tucker like farming but its hard{work.}They do not employ any other people.
